title: Who is Charles Andermack?
content:
This article from today's NYTimes seems to be confusing Charles Anderson with someone named Charles Andermack. Unless he got pranked (Chanked?), then I must say "bravo!"

[http://www.nytimes.com/2008/06/26/technology/personaltech/26basics.html?...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017011736/http:/www.nytimes.com/2008/06/26/technology/personaltech/26basics.html?em&ex=1214712000&en=a2063db595baad4a&ei=5087%0A "http://www.nytimes.com/2008/06/26/technology/personaltech/26basics.html?em&ex=1214712000&en=a2063db595baad4a&ei=5087%0A")
author: enrico_limcaco

comments.content: I wondered about that. I wouldn't be surprised if Chank threw a curveball.
Yep, I think it's a hybrid between Anderson (Chanks real last name) and Olmack (El Mack de los Toros real name)

And let's not forget baby Max Diesel - who's just turned 2 :-)

[http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoID=126...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017011736/http:/vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoID=1268799827 "http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoID=1268799827")

Yeah, that's me.  
It's no prank.  
Born Charles Anderson.  
Then I got a new, married name, Charles Andermack.

Si is right, it's a hybrid, my wife and I smashed our names together,  
because we didn't want to deal with hyphenated names.  
So we just made up a new legal family name.

Everybody still calls me "Chank".

That's who you should make the check payable to.  
Thanks.

-chank

-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+

Chank Co [http://www.chank.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017011736/http:/www.chank.com/ "http://www.chank.com")  
PO Box 580736  
Minneapolis, MN 55458 • USA

-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
If I had have done that I would be Nick Shinnstine.

"Si is right, it’s a hybrid, my wife and I smashed our names together"

Ah! I was thinking that a) I either feel dumb and thought Chank's real name was something else for the past 10 years, or b) the NYT actually screwed up.
